intro: Biscutella laevigata subsp. subaphylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf biscuitroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, and it produces small, yellow flowers in early spring. This subspecies is characterized by its distinctive morphology and ecological niche in semi-arid habitats.
